item.title: Random Variable and Expectation_
item.description: Discrete Random Variables and Expectations Start off with an example, using the most normal element we would use in fundamental probability to explain combinations and outcomes in an event, two die. With this two dice we will have 36 possible outcomes. Let $(a, b)$ denote a possible outcome of rolling the two die, with the number on the top of the first die and b the number on the top of the second die.
